channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: An Incremental Learning Approach for Sustainable Region Isolation and Integration
item.description: In this paper, we mimic partitioned learning and memory replay in the human brain and propose an incremental learning approach named SRII, short for sustainable regional isolation and integration.

item.title: Ghost-free High Dynamic Range Imaging via Hybrid CNN-Transformer and Structure Tensor
item.description: In this letter, we present a hybrid model consisting of a convolutional encoder and a Transformer decoder to generate ghost-free HDR images.

item.title: Principled Multi-Aspect Evaluation Measures of Rankings
item.description: Information Retrieval evaluation has traditionally focused on defining principled ways of assessing the relevance of a ranked list of documents with respect to a query.

item.title: Biomedical NER for the Enterprise with Distillated BERN2 and the Kazu Framework
item.description: In order to assist the drug discovery/development process, pharmaceutical companies often apply biomedical NER and linking techniques over internal and public corpora.

item.title: Assessing the Impact of Music Recommendation Diversity on Listeners: A Longitudinal Study
item.description: We present the results of a 12-week longitudinal user study wherein the participants, 110 subjects from Southern Europe, received on a daily basis Electronic Music (EM) diversified recommendations.

item.title: A Commonsense-Infused Language-Agnostic Learning Framework for Enhancing Prediction of Political Polarity in Multilingual News Headlines
item.description: With attended knowledge in our framework, the same model show an increase in 2. 2% accuracy and F1, and 3. 6% jaccard score.

item.title: GrannGAN: Graph annotation generative adversarial networks
item.description: The model we propose tackles the problem of generating the data features constrained by the specific graph structure of each data point by splitting the task into two phases.

item.title: Neural Representations Reveal Distinct Modes of Class Fitting in Residual Convolutional Networks
item.description: To this end, we estimate class-conditional density models for representations learned by deep ResNets.

item.title: Unsupervised Linear and Iterative Combinations of Patches for Image Denoising
item.description: We introduce a parametric view of non-local two-step denoisers, for which BM3D is a major representative, where quadratic risk minimization is leveraged for unsupervised optimization.

item.title: Hyperbolic Contrastive Learning for Visual Representations beyond Objects
item.description: To exploit such a structure, we propose a contrastive learning framework where a Euclidean loss is used to learn object representations and a hyperbolic loss is used to encourage representations of scenes to lie close to representations of their constituent objects in a hyperbolic space.

item.title: FoPro: Few-Shot Guided Robust Webly-Supervised Prototypical Learning
item.description: Most existing methods focus on learning noise-robust models from web images while neglecting the performance drop caused by the differences between web domain and real-world domain.

item.title: Explainable Artificial Intelligence for Improved Modeling of Processes
item.description: On the other hand, Machine Learning (ML) benefits from the vast amount of data available and can deal with high-dimensional sources, yet it has rarely been applied to being used in processes.

item.title: Prasatul Matrix: A Direct Comparison Approach for Analyzing Evolutionary Optimization Algorithms
item.description: In this paper, a direct comparison approach is proposed to analyze the performance of evolutionary optimization algorithms.

item.title: AC-Band: A Combinatorial Bandit-Based Approach to Algorithm Configuration
item.description: We study the algorithm configuration (AC) problem, in which one seeks to find an optimal parameter configuration of a given target algorithm in an automated way.

item.title: Super-CLEVR: A Virtual Benchmark to Diagnose Domain Robustness in Visual Reasoning
item.description: Visual Question Answering (VQA) models often perform poorly on out-of-distribution data and struggle on domain generalization.

item.title: IRRGN: An Implicit Relational Reasoning Graph Network for Multi-turn Response Selection
item.description: URR aims to implicitly extract dependencies between utterances, as well as utterances and options, and make reasoning with relational graph convolutional networks.

item.title: Finetune like you pretrain: Improved finetuning of zero-shot vision models
item.description: In total, these benchmarks establish contrastive finetuning as a simple, intuitive, and state-of-the-art approach for supervised finetuning of image-text models like CLIP.

item.title: Unbiased Heterogeneous Scene Graph Generation with Relation-aware Message Passing Neural Network
item.description: Recent scene graph generation (SGG) frameworks have focused on learning complex relationships among multiple objects in an image.

item.title: PIZZA: A new benchmark for complex end-to-end task-oriented parsing
item.description: Much recent work in task-oriented parsing has focused on finding a middle ground between flat slots and intents, which are inexpressive but easy to annotate, and powerful representations such as the lambda calculus, which are expressive but costly to annotate.

item.title: Fine-Grained Selective Similarity Integration for Drug-Target Interaction Prediction
item.description: Recently, with the availability of abundant heterogeneous biological information from diverse data sources, computational methods have been able to leverage multiple drug and target similarities to boost the performance of DTI prediction.

item.title: Long-Document Cross-Lingual Summarization
item.description: Cross-Lingual Summarization (CLS) aims at generating summaries in one language for the given documents in another language.

item.title: MGTANet: Encoding Sequential LiDAR Points Using Long Short-Term Motion-Guided Temporal Attention for 3D Object Detection
item.description: While conventional 3D object detectors use a set of unordered LiDAR points acquired over a fixed time interval, recent studies have revealed that substantial performance improvement can be achieved by exploiting the spatio-temporal context present in a sequence of LiDAR point sets.

item.title: Concealed Object Detection for Passive Millimeter-Wave Security Imaging Based on Task-Aligned Detection Transformer
item.description: Passive millimeter-wave (PMMW) is a significant potential technique for human security screening.

item.title: Attribute-based Representations for Accurate and Interpretable Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: Surprisingly, we find that this simple representation is sufficient to achieve state-of-the-art performance in ShanghaiTech, the largest and most complex VAD dataset.

item.title: FakeOut: Leveraging Out-of-domain Self-supervision for Multi-modal Video Deepfake Detection
item.description: This poses a problem, especially in the era of social media, as synthetic videos of speaking humans can be used to spread misinformation in a convincing manner.

item.title: Zero-Shot Image Restoration Using Denoising Diffusion Null-Space Model
item.description: Most existing Image Restoration (IR) models are task-specific, which can not be generalized to different degradation operators.

item.title: Improving Zero-Shot Models with Label Distribution Priors
item.description: We propose a new approach, CLIPPR (CLIP with Priors), which adapts zero-shot models for regression and classification on unlabelled datasets.

item.title: Mixed Neural Voxels for Fast Multi-view Video Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we present a novel method named MixVoxels to better represent the dynamic scenes with fast training speed and competitive rendering qualities.

item.title: EHRSQL: A Practical Text-to-SQL Benchmark for Electronic Health Records
item.description: We present a new text-to-SQL dataset for electronic health records (EHRs), where the utterances are collected from 222 hospital staff—including physicians, nurses, insurance review and health records teams, and more.

item.title: Score Jacobian Chaining: Lifting Pretrained 2D Diffusion Models for 3D Generation
item.description: We propose to apply chain rule on the learned gradients, and back-propagate the score of a diffusion model through the Jacobian of a differentiable renderer, which we instantiate to be a voxel radiance field.

item.title: Semiconductor Defect Pattern Classification by Self-Proliferation-and-Attention Neural Network
item.description: In this paper, we present a novel architecture that can perform defect classification in a more efficient way.

item.title: Differentially Private Adaptive Optimization with Delayed Preconditioners
item.description: Privacy noise may negate the benefits of using adaptive optimizers in differentially private model training.

item.title: What do you MEME? Generating Explanations for Visual Semantic Role Labelling in Memes
item.description: Here, we introduce a novel task - EXCLAIM, generating explanations for visual semantic role labeling in memes.

item.title: Early prediction of the risk of ICU mortality with Deep Federated Learning
item.description: In this study, we evaluate the ability of deep Federated Learning to predict the risk of Intensive Care Unit mortality at an early stage.

item.title: Data-Efficient Finetuning Using Cross-Task Nearest Neighbors
item.description: We assume access to a small number (250--1000) of unlabeled target task instances, select their nearest neighbors from a pool of multitask data, and use the retrieved data to train target task-specific models.

item.title: Learning Combinatorial Structures via Markov Random Fields with Sampling through Lovász Local Lemma
item.description: Because of the highly intractable nature of the gradient estimation of the learning objective subject to combinatorial constraints.

item.title: Enabling Fast Unit Commitment Constraint Screening via Learning Cost Model
item.description: Unit commitment (UC) are essential tools to transmission system operators for finding the most economical and feasible generation schedules and dispatch signals.

item.title: Deep Kernel Learning for Mortality Prediction in the Face of Temporal Shift
item.description: This often leads to drop in the performance of neural models for prospective patients, especially in terms of their calibration.

item.title: CL4CTR: A Contrastive Learning Framework for CTR Prediction
item.description: Many Click-Through Rate (CTR) prediction works focused on designing advanced architectures to model complex feature interactions but neglected the importance of feature representation learning, e. g., adopting a plain embedding layer for each feature, which results in sub-optimal feature representations and thus inferior CTR prediction performance.

item.title: ODPP: A Unified Algorithm Framework for Unsupervised Option Discovery based on Determinantal Point Process
item.description: Learning rich skills through temporal abstractions without supervision of external rewards is at the frontier of Reinforcement Learning research.

item.title: On the Compatibility between a Neural Network and a Partial Differential Equation for Physics-informed Learning
item.description: Inspired by this pitfall, we prove that a linear PDE up to the $n$-th order can be strictly satisfied by an MLP with $C^n$ activation functions when the weights of its output layer lie on a certain hyperplane, as called the out-layer-hyperplane.

item.title: GRiT: A Generative Region-to-text Transformer for Object Understanding
item.description: Specifically, GRiT consists of a visual encoder to extract image features, a foreground object extractor to localize objects, and a text decoder to generate open-set object descriptions.

item.title: Learning to Generate Text-grounded Mask for Open-world Semantic Segmentation from Only Image-Text Pairs
item.description: Existing open-world segmentation methods have shown impressive advances by employing contrastive learning (CL) to learn diverse visual concepts and adapting the learned image-level understanding to the segmentation task.

item.title: Protein Language Models and Structure Prediction: Connection and Progression
item.description: The prediction of protein structures from sequences is an important task for function prediction, drug design, and related biological processes understanding.

item.title: Single Slice Thigh CT Muscle Group Segmentation with Domain Adaptation and Self-Training
item.description: The proposed pipeline is effective and robust in extracting muscle groups on 2D single slice CT thigh images. The container is available for public use at https://github. com/MASILab/DA_CT_muscle_seg

item.title: From Coarse to Fine: Hierarchical Pixel Integration for Lightweight Image Super-Resolution
item.description: In the fine area, we use an Intra-Patch Self-Attention (IPSA) module to model long-range pixel dependencies in a local patch, and then a $3\times3$ convolution is applied to process the finest details.

item.title: General policy mapping: online continual reinforcement learning inspired on the insect brain
item.description: Our model leverages the offline training of a feature extraction and a common general policy layer to enable the convergence of RL algorithms in online settings.

item.title: Linking Sketch Patches by Learning Synonymous Proximity for Graphic Sketch Representation
item.description: The cropped sketch patches are linked according to their global semantics or local geometric shapes, namely the synonymous proximity, by computing the cosine similarity between the captured patch embeddings.

item.title: Learning Motion-Robust Remote Photoplethysmography through Arbitrary Resolution Videos
item.description: Remote photoplethysmography (rPPG) enables non-contact heart rate (HR) estimation from facial videos which gives significant convenience compared with traditional contact-based measurements.

item.title: Predicting Properties of Quantum Systems with Conditional Generative Models
item.description: Alternatively, kernel methods can predict local observables by learning from measurements on different but related states.
